concept.title: Upgrade a Basic Installation from the RPM Package
concept.shortdesc: When you upgrade a basic installation from the RPM package, the new version uses the default configuration, data, log, and resource directories. If the previous version used the default directories, the new version has access to the files created in the previous version.

conbody.p: upgradebasic installation from RPMbasic install from RPMupgradeIf the previous version used customized values for the directory environment variables, you must make the same customizations in the new version so that the new version can access the same files.
conbody.note: If you installed additional drivers or developed custom stages, verify that those libraries are stored in a local directory external to the installation directory before you upgrade. That way, can still use the libraries after the upgrade.
conbody.p: To upgrade a basic installation from the RPM package, perform the following steps:

ol.li: Back up the environment configuration file in the previous version.
Manually update the environment configuration file.
Install additional stage libraries as needed.
